src:
Mislim Siti, kažem Genk
Liverpul na relativno lakom ispitu, Salcburg juri poslednji voz

05 Nov 2019

Prvi krug je obrnut, red je da se krene u drugi. Presek na polovini grupne faze je takav da Napoli i Liverpul očekivano drže dve prve pozicije u Grupi E, a za vratom im trenutno diše ekipa Salcburga koja se odlično pokazala u dosadašnjem toku takmičenja, ali kojoj će večeras ipak biti neophodna pobeda kako bi produžila nadu za plasman u nokaut fazu takmičenja.
Baš zbog toga će večerašnji meč sa Napolijem u Italiji (Arena Sport 3, 21.00) biti od velikog rezultatskog značaja. Pre svega dve nedelje u Austriji, italijanski sastav je nekako uspeo da pobegne od kandži veoma dobrog domaćina i da slavi u efikasnoj utakmici - 2:3.
Ni večeras ne treba očekivati ništa manje interesantan okršaj, pošto je reč o dve ekipe koje gaje isključivo napadački stil fudbala. Zbog toga ne treba ni da čudi činjenica da je Salcburg na svega tri odigrane utakmice postigao vrtoglavih 11 golova. Napoli je dao čak šest manje, ali ipak se nalazi na čelu grupe.
Kako navode italijanski mediji, Salcburg bi mogao da krene sa Lorencom Insinjeom, Irvingom Lozanom i Drijesom Mertensom u prednjoj liniji, jer faktički znaju da bi im pobeda već sada obezbedila prolazak u drugu fazu takmičenja. Zbog toga bi na klupi večeras mogli da „završe“ Arkadijuš Milik i Fernando Ljorente.
Ono što ipak može da raduje fudbalere Salcburga jeste činjenica da se Napoli nalazi u relativno lošoj formi, pa ih je zbog toga predsednik Aurelijo de Laurentis smestio u izolovani kamp. Nadaće se u Italiji da će to dati pozitivan rezultat već na večerašnjoj utakmici.
Liverpul ne bi smeo da sebi dodatno zakomplikuje situaciju u grupi protiv Genka (Arena Sport 4, 21.00). Pre dve nedelje, Redsi su u Belgiji uspeli da postignu četiri gola protiv istog tima, tako da je na Enfildu zaista teško očekivati bilo šta drugačije.
Uzimajući u obzir da se Genk nalazi u zaista katastrofalnoj formi, pošto na minulih pet utakmica ima tri poraza, pobedu i remi, sve sem ubedljivog trijumfa Liverpula bi bilo prvorazredno iznenađenje. Naročito ako se ispostave kao tačne tvrdnje da će Jirgen Klop sutra na teren izvesti najjači tim.
Trener Liverpula ističe da su sve oči usmere upravo ka Genku, iako je pred Redsima izuzetno važan duel u Premijer ligi naročitog vikenda protiv Mančester sitija, koji bi mogao ozbiljno da utiče na rasplet na Ostrvu, iako je tek uvodni deo sezone.„Niko ne razmišlja i ne moram uopšte ni da im govorim da je Siti u nedelju, a Genk večeras. Imamo veće ambicije u ovom takmičenju, tako da ćemo pokušati da damo svoj maksimum. Uopšte ni ne sumnjam u svoje fudbalere, mislim da bi me bilo pomalo i sramota kada bih morao da im kažem da ne misle o Sitiju u ovom trenutku“, izjavio je Jirgen Klop.
Genk je samo jednom u istoriji gostovao u Engleskoj. Pre osam godina protiv Čelsija na Stamford Bridžu doživeo je pravi debakl primivši čak pet golova u grupnoj fazi Lige šampiona. Liverpul sigurno ne bi imao ništa protiv da se ista priča ponovi večeras.
Na ruku im ide i tradicija na Enfildu koja kaže da na domaćem terenu nisu izgubili na poslednje 23 utakmice, a poslednji put su poklekli davne 2014. godine kada su izgubili od Real Madrida na domaćem terenu.

text:
I mean City, I say Genk
Liverpool on a relatively easy exam, Salzburg is chasing the last train

05 Nov 2019

The first round is reversed, it's time to move to the second. The half-way cut through the group stage is such that Napoli and Liverpool are expected to hold the top two spots in Group E, with the Salzburg team currently breathing down their neck, which has excelled in the competition so far, but which will still need a win tonight to extend hope for placement in the knockout phase of the competition.
That is why tonight's match with Napoli in Italy (Arena Sport 3, 21.00) will be of great result. Just two weeks ago in Austria, the Italian squad somehow managed to escape the clutches of a very good host and to celebrate in an effective match - 2: 3.
No less interesting clash is to be expected tonight, as these are two teams that are purely attacking football style. Therefore, it should come as no surprise that Salzburg has scored a dizzying 11 goals in just three games played. Napoli has given as many as six less, but is still at the head of the group.
According to the Italian media, Salzburg could go with Lorenzo Insinje, Irving Lausanne and Dries Mertens in the front line, as they actually know that a victory would already provide them with a pass to the second stage of the competition. That is why Arkady Milik and Fernando Lorente could be "finished" on the bench tonight.
What can still make Salzburg footballers happy is the fact that Napoli is in relatively poor shape, which is why President Aurelijo de Laurentis placed them in an isolated camp. It is hoped in Italy that this will give a positive result already at tonight's game.
Liverpool should not further complicate the situation in the group against Genk (Arena Sport 4, 21.00). Two weeks ago, the Reds were able to score four goals against the same team in Belgium, so it's really hard to expect anything different at Enfield.
Considering that Genk is in really disastrous shape, as there are three defeats in the past five games, a win and a draw, anything but Liverpool's convincing triumph would be a first-rate surprise. Especially if they turn out to be true claims that Jirgen Klop will bring the strongest team to the field tomorrow.
The Liverpool coach points out that all eyes are on Genk, although the Reds have a very important Premier League duel against Manchester City, which could seriously affect the outcome on the Island, although it is only the introductory part of the season. and I don't even have to tell them that City is Sunday and Genk is tonight. We have bigger ambitions in this competition, so we will try to give our maximum. I don't even doubt my footballers, I think it would be a little embarrassing for me to tell them not to think about Siti at this point, "Jirgen Klop said.
Genk has only once made history in England. Eight years ago against Chelsea at Stamford Bridge he experienced a real debacle, receiving as many as five goals in the Champions League group stage. Liverpool certainly wouldn't mind repeating the same story tonight.
The Enfield tradition also says that they have not lost in their last 23 games at home, and they last bowed in 2014 when they lost to Real Madrid at home.
